place_of_publication.other_info_on_pub: * Alexandrian laurel [Greek kalos , beautiful, and phyllon , leaf] I

bio:treatment.description: and alternating with and usually more prominent than latex canals, without tertiary venation visible between lateral veins. Inflorescences racemiform; peduncle and rachis usually present; bracts usually deciduous,
sepals deciduous, 4, distinct, in decussate pairs, outer 1–2 pairs rarely much different from rest;
ca. 4 times as long as ovary. Fruits drupaceous
bio:treatment.discussion: Species ca. 190 (1 in the flora): introduced, Florida; Mexico, West Indies, Central America, South America, Asia, Africa, Indian Ocean Islands (Madagascar), Pacific Islands.
Calophyllum includes about ten species in the American tropics, the rest in Asia, Africa, Madagascar, and the Pacific.

references.reference: Stevens, P. F. 1980. A revision of the Old World species of Calophyllum (Guttiferae). J. Arnold Arbor. 61: 117–699.
